story.text: Throughout human history, stories have been central to our existence, the signal within the noise, recognisable patterns in which we find meaning and give sense to our world. The power of stories

What make us human If stories themselves are universal, the way we tell them changes with the technology at hand and every new medium has given rise to new forms of narrative. With the arrival of the internet, our stories broke loose from their linear boundaries, becoming hyperlinked storylines, delivered in mutable and complex formats (audio, video and text).
An open communication channel where participation is not only possible but expected and collective imagination can reach its full potential.

# Place

- Category:  [[People]]
- Moment: [[Middle Ages]]

# Concepts

The workshop explores the following concepts:

- [[Digital Republic]], [[Nation State]], [[Republic of Science]]
- [[Citizen Assembly]], [[Liquid Democracy]]
- [[Consent]], [[Science]], [[Expertise]], [[Wisdom]]
- [[Empathy]], [[Film]], [[Documentray]]
- [[Visual Novel]], [[Non-linear narrative]], [[Conversation]]

From work to our personal lives, how do we agree on where (our) boundaries are? What is consent? How does it differ from other forms of decision making? And what do you need to make it work?
Vincent van der Lubbe, Chair of Sociocracy for All, will guide you through the logical steps of consent, help you experiment with how they can work and what challenges lie ahead.

# Concepts
The workshop explores the following concepts:

- [[What is democracy?]]
# Workshop Details

The Age of Consent - Decision Making for Now

Vincent van der Lubbe
Chair Sociocracy for All / Hansei Consulting

Afternoon Day 1
Saturday 25th October
Start: 15:55  -  End: 16:20
